cards.task: Deploy an application to App Engine
cards.description: Deploys your application code and configuration to Google App Engine.
cards.whenToUse: When pushing a new version of your app to production.
scenarios: Initial deployment: Launching your app for the first time
Updates: Pushing new features to production
Bug fixes: Deploying hotfixes quickly

cards.description: Creates an App Engine application in your project in the specified region.
cards.whenToUse: When setting up App Engine for the first time in a project.
scenarios: Project setup: Initializing App Engine before first deploy
Region selection: Choosing where your app will run
New project: Setting up infrastructure for a new application

cards.task: Open the deployed app in a browser
cards.description: Opens your App Engine application's URL in a web browser.
cards.whenToUse: When you want to quickly view your deployed application.
scenarios: Verification: Checking that deployment succeeded
Quick access: Opening your app without finding the URL
Demo: Showing the app to stakeholders

cards.description: Displays the most recent logs from your App Engine application.
cards.whenToUse: When debugging issues or monitoring your application.
scenarios: Debugging: Finding error messages after a crash
Monitoring: Checking application health
Verification: Confirming requests are being handled

cards.task: Stream App Engine logs in real-time
cards.description: Continuously streams new log entries as they occur.
cards.whenToUse: When monitoring live traffic or debugging in real-time.
scenarios: Live debugging: Watching logs while testing features
Incident response: Monitoring during an outage
Load testing: Watching behavior under traffic

cards.task: List all deployed App Engine versions
cards.description: Shows all deployed versions of your App Engine services with traffic allocation.
cards.whenToUse: When managing versions or preparing to clean up old deployments.
scenarios: Version audit: Seeing all deployed versions
Traffic check: Verifying which version is receiving traffic
Cleanup: Identifying old versions to delete

cards.task: Configure Docker credentials for Google Container Registry
cards.description: Registers gcloud as a Docker credential helper for pushing to GCR.
cards.whenToUse: Before pushing Docker images to Google Container Registry.
scenarios: Initial setup: Configuring Docker to work with GCR
New machine: Setting up container development environment
CI/CD: Preparing build environment for container pushes

cards.description: Creates a new Google Kubernetes Engine cluster for running containers.
cards.whenToUse: When setting up Kubernetes infrastructure for containerized apps.
scenarios: Container platform: Setting up Kubernetes for your team
Microservices: Creating infrastructure for a microservices architecture
Development: Creating a cluster for testing Kubernetes deployments

cards.task: Get credentials for kubectl to access a GKE cluster
cards.description: Updates kubeconfig so kubectl can connect to your GKE cluster.
cards.whenToUse: After creating a cluster or on a new machine to access an existing cluster.
scenarios: Cluster access: Connecting kubectl to your cluster
New machine: Setting up access on a different computer
Context switching: Connecting to a different cluster

cards.task: List all GKE clusters in the project
cards.description: Shows all Kubernetes Engine clusters with their status and node count.
cards.whenToUse: When reviewing cluster infrastructure or finding cluster details.
scenarios: Inventory: Reviewing all running clusters
Cost audit: Checking cluster sizes and node counts
Status check: Verifying clusters are running correctly
